Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label a fish, showing its parts clearly.
The student can draw and label water, which is the habitat where fish live.
The student can draw and label other elements in the fish's habitat, such as plants and rocks.
The student can illustrate and label important needs of the fish, such as food sources and clean water.
The student can show the relationship between the fish and its habitat, explaining how the habitat meets the fish's needs through labeling or simple descriptions.
The student can demonstrate how the different parts of the fish's habitat work together to support life using labels or simple descriptions.
